reviewText: CONTENTS of MAFIA GREATEST HITS 4 Movie Pack: ESCAPE FROM DEATH ROW-- Best here is this Euro-made crime film fronted by Lee Van Cleef. Two gangster inmates pool resources on a prison break so that one can reclaim territory stolen from him in his native France and the other might become a mob "made" man. FAMILY ENFORCER-- Joe Pesci (in his first credited movie role) is third banana in this story of a New Jersey kid who takes a job as an enforcer/debt collector. HIT LADY-- Scripted by Yvette Mimieux and directed by Ed Wynn's grandson, this "Movie of the Week" concerns a lovely artist who leads a double life as a contract killer. Good cast in a sanitized for television underworld story. MOB WAR-- The "Raging Bull" (middleweight boxer Jake LaMotta) stars in this poorly executed indie film about a gangster who runs afoul of his Don (LaMotta) when he hires a publicity agent after a big cocaine deal gets busted up by NYPD. PERFECT HEISTS 4 Movie Pack is yet another BCI / Eclipse crime drama DVD collection. BRENTWOOD's 4-fers are nicely priced movie bundles. Video and sound quality of these digitally unrestored public domain films is generally fine. Discs are dual-side recorded. . Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website (5.7) Escape from Death Row (Italy/France-1973) - Lee Van Cleef/Tony Lo Bianco/Edwige Fenech (4.7) Family Enforcer ("The Death Collector") (1976) - Joseph Cortese/Lou Criscuolo/Joe Pesci (5.4) Hit Lady (TV-1974) - Yvette Mimieux/Joseph Campanella/Clu Gulager/Dack Rambo/Keenan Wynn (2.3) Mob War (1989) - Jake LaMotta/Johnny Stumper/David Henry Keller/John Rano

Ok, so I'm into mafia type movies, and purchased this because it was only 10 bucks. The disk brings like 3 or 4 movies. They are all very low budget and poorly made movies. Some low-budget movies can still be very entertaining if they have a good story line - but not these. The movie with Joe Pesci is semi-entertaining, but not worth the money. Another film is some really whack type of documentary on some mobster. So anyway, the point is that you should not consider purchasing this DVD if you are looking for entertainment.
